title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 470.5 - Setoff against unemployment insurance benefits
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 470.5 - Setoff against unemployment insurance benefits

State Regulations

Established and outstanding overpaid unemployment
insurance benefits shall be collected from a claimant's weekly benefit award as
a setoff. (a) Priority of liquidation. In the event that more than one overpayment is established against an
individual claimant, setoff amounts will be debited to such overpayments in
chronological order. (b) Willful
overpayment. A setoff of 100 percent of the weekly benefit amount will apply to
one or more established and outstanding overpayments attributable to an
individual claimant so long as at least one of such overpayments is determined
to have been willful. (c) Non-willful overpayment. A setoff of 50 percent of the weekly benefit amount
will apply to one or more established and outstanding overpayments attributable
to an individual claimant so long as none of such overpayments are determined
to have been willful. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12
ยง
470.5

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
